results.title: Grapevine pruning
results.brief_description: The method of pruning sultana grapes developed as a result of research on vine buds and shoots, is shown. The correct methods of pruning Zante currants, Gordos, and other varieties of grapes is also shown. The research work was carried out by CSIRO at the Commonwealth Research Station, Merbein, Victoria.

results.title: Grapes are growing
results.creator_credit: Peter Menzies, John Kingsford-Smith, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Australia’s wine industry. Shows the factors leading to high quality grapes; the process of wine making in which grapes are tested, weighed, transported, crushed, fermented, stored and bottled ready for use. Includes the traditional method of making ‘champagne’ and the importance of the Australian Wine Research Institute and Roseworthy College.

results.title: Granville
results.brief_description: Depicts the aftermath of the railway disaster at Granville, New South Wales in February 1977. Eighty-two persons were killed and over eighty were injured. The film shows the rescue operations in action. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Grant Wood 1892-1942 (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Presents the story of Grant Wood, an American self-taught artist who painted the gentle curves of his neighbouring hills, the neatly ploughed fields, the daily routine of western life as well as such classic themes in American History as Paul Revere’s ride. The film brings together a collection of Grant Wood’s best work. Credits include: photography by John Lewis; music by Lan Adomian. Narrated by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Skeleton of an empire
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hearst and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Grandeur that Was Rome”.
Sir Mortimer Wheeler surveys the remains of the Roman Empire and examines its great length and breadth, from Hadrian’s Wall in northern England to the southern perimeter in the Sahara, from Merida in Spain eastwards to Jerash in Jordan.

results.title: Gods and men
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Grandeur that Was Rome”.
Famous British archaeologist Sir Mortimer Wheeler introduces the story of Christian influence on the degraded Roman Empire, with its cynical worship of gods. A message and belief was brought to spiritually empty Rome.

results.title: Roman art and architecture
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hearst and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Grandeur that Was Rome”.
A discussion of ancient Rome’s art and architecture, particularly of functional constructions such as aqueducts, and of domes and large interiors.

results.title: The Grand design
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: Shows the beginnings of the United Nations Organization, its political work for peace, and its achievements and aims in the fields of agriculture, health, and famine control Perhaps most inspiring are the sections dealing with economic aid and health projects which show how wide is the UN’s scope and effectiveness it these fields.

results.title: Grand Central Market
results.creator_credit: William Hale and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: In the city of Los Angeles, California, is a large central food market catering for the needs of its large population. This film shows the mixed population of the area shopping in an atmosphere of freedom and friendship.

results.title: Grampians wonderland
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description:
The Grampians mountain ranges rising from the plains of western Victoria were discovered by Major Mitchell and continue to delight tourists. This program shows the exquisite wildflowers, the animal life, the rugged mountain scenery and the foaming waterfalls which make the Grampians so beautiful and so popular. Winner of an AFI Award: 1959.

The convertable car used in this film is a Triumph TR3A.
